attributes.action: Inquiries into rape, abuse and systematic grooming of children be independent
attributes.background: For at least forty five years, in many of our cities and towns, rape and sexual abuse of children has been ongoing and systematic. Regular reports have been made to all official capacities in those places without effect or action taken by them. It is not felt internal inquiry would be efficacious
attributes.additional_details:
In addition to the inquiry committee being fully independent, the panel should comprise of at least four of the affected parents from each city and town and in a fully paid participant capacity for the duration of the inquiry.

That those parents be rotated each week and afforded FULL police security before, during and after inquiries as necessary.

That employers consider any time away from jobs in the same way as Jury Duty

attributes.action: Make it illegal to charge a single room supplement
attributes.background: This is a petition to ask parliament to make it illegal for hoteliers and tour operators to apply a surcharge to the hotel or holiday booking of anyone travelling on their own. It is routine in the travel industry for a holidaymaker to pay a supplement for occupying a single-bedded hotel room.
attributes.additional_details: I have spoken with several people who often have to travel on their own, many of them believing the supplement to be unfair and unnecessary, especially as there is usually nothing special about the single rooms they are allocated. In my experience, there isn't usually anything exceptional offered in the single room which one could say would attract a surcharge. The rooms are usually tiny, with neither room to "swing a cat", nor a particularly special view outside the window. If you agree that single travellers face unfair discrimination, please sign the petition.

attributes.action: Establish baseline health monitoring for communities less than 3km from fracking
attributes.background:
Public Health England state about fracking:

'Baseline environmental monitoring is needed to facilitate the assessment of the impact of shale gas extraction on the environment and public health.'

Baseline health monitoring is equally essential to protect community health. Yet absent.
attributes.additional_details:
What is a health baseline?
It measures existing illness and potential future illness. Your current baseline has been shaped by your medical, social and family history and is constantly being influenced by your environment. 
Fracking has proven risk factors. 

Respiratory issues: https://jamanetwork.com/journals/jamainternalmedicine/fullarticle/2534153

Pregnancy issues:
http://advances.sciencemag.org/content/3/12/e1603021

Other:
http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0048969716325724

attributes.action: Split Leeds and Bradford City Councils into smaller district councils.
attributes.background: Leeds & Bradford City Councils are too large to focus of individual communities. On greenbelt protection, providing cheaper housing on brownfield sites, transport & modernising infrastructure, local people's views are often ignored. Smaller councils would be accountable to more localised voters.
attributes.additional_details:
Leeds & Bradford City Councils planned too much housing for greenbelt sites & failed to act sufficiently on local views. This would have defeated the objectives of greenbelt by merging communities with urban sprawl & destroying their historical character. Leeds' revised plans still have greenbelt in reserve for development as "Broad Locations".

An Act of Parliament could restore councils which existed before 1974, such as Aireborough, Horsforth, Keighley, Morley, Pudsey, Shipley & Wharfedale.

attributes.action: Change the law to recognise Domestic Abuse as a crime in its own right
attributes.background: Currently if a victim goes to the police to report Domestic Abuse it will often be classed as Common Assualt which has to be reported within 6 months or action cannot be taken. Many victims do not have the confidence or courage to come forward within the timescale required by law.
attributes.additional_details: The laws relating to domestic abuse are outdated. Many victims do not have the confidence to talk about their abuse for many years and when they find the courage to speak out and report the crime they find that the law only allows them 6 months to report it. Quite often the abuser will go on to assualt another victim. It is time that domestic abuse was recognised as a crime in its own right and the timescale changed to help the frightened and sometimes terrified victims.

attributes.action: Make gcse exams free for all children under 18, including home educated children
attributes.background: Currently, parents/carers of home educated children must pay around Â£200 per GCSE subject that their child wishes to sit exams for (including exam board and exam centre fees). This actively discriminates against home educated children and should be funded by the government.
attributes.additional_details: Children and parents sometimes choose home education due to disabilities or vulnerability (for example, due to psychological issues caused by bullying brought about as a result of the main stream schooling system). As well as discriminating against home education, forcing parents/carers to pay for gcse exams out of their own pocket may result in gcse qualifications becoming less accessible to vulnerable children. This also risks certain disabled children starting life with fewer qualifications.

attributes.action: Parliament to change the law regarding council tax
attributes.background:
Parliament to change the law, so that local councils can't increase council tax by more than inflation. 
Most people in the UK do not get a wage increase more than the rate of inflation and therefore can't afford a council tax rise of 5%.

attributes.action: Change the law regarding Parental Responsibility
attributes.background: When family member such as grandparent, aunt, uncle etc is bringing up a family member such as grandchild, nephew, niece etc, unless it would harm the child to do so such family members to be automatically granted Parental Responsibility.
attributes.additional_details: Tens of thousands of grandparents bringing up grandchildren in the absence of one or both parents cannot get Parental Responsibility without a tedious, expensive and often contentious court process. This applies even in cirumstances where the mother is deceased, the father shown not to be the biological father by DNA testing and not playing any part in bringing up the child concerned. Unless it would harm child to do so, Grandparents to be automatically given Parental Responsibility.

attributes.action: Residents of Thanet to engage with the Secretary of State and Thanet District Co
attributes.background: To enable the residents of Thanet to engage with the Secretary of State and Thanet District Council, to make clear their views on the objectives for the proposed Thanet plan.
attributes.additional_details:
Thanet District Council at a meeting the other week rejected the Local Plan .
So the Secretary of State said he will be getting involved. 
We the Residents would like to put our views over to the Secretary of State and our reservation on the numbers talked about

attributes.action: Bring the Bayeux Tapestry to Hastings (or Battle).
attributes.background: It's great President Macron has agreed to loan the Bayeux Tapestry to the UK. It should be displayed in Hastings (or Battle), home of the historic battleground. It would also be a huge boost for the area's tourism.

attributes.action: Grant Tier 1 General Applicants ILR After 5 Years Continuous Legal Stay In UK
attributes.background: Tier 1 general migrants are experiencing great unfairness and inhumane treatment from the Home Office. Many have been criminalized or turned into illegal immigrants by the hostile immigration rules. With the program wrapped up on 6 April 2018, many in this category have been adversely affected.
attributes.additional_details:
Home Office base refusal decisions for leave to remain on unfair premises such as failing genuine income test even when tax has been paid on such income or citing minor tax errors. Most of these decisions cannot be subject to reasonable challenge due to the black letter law of the Point Based System introduced in 2014 that implicitly confers absolute power on decision makers.

Tier 1 migrants took legal route offered by the UK in migrating here, it is morally unfair to deny them their rights.

attributes.action: Put young offenders in prison for knife crime
attributes.background: The law for sentencing needs to be updated. People convicted of crimes involving knives should go to prison no matter what their age. They should not be allowed out on the streets if found guilty.
attributes.additional_details: There was a case recently where the defendant was under 18 and pleaded guilty to stabbing someone. There was also video evidence that the defendant had broken his court bail conditions. He just got reminded of his bail conditions - nothing else. He wasnât sentenced to prison, even though he could have killed someone.

attributes.action: Revoke journalist Lauren Southern's ban from the United Kingdom.
attributes.background:
Lauren Southern is a right-wing Canadian journalist who has been banned from entering the UK by the UK Home Office. 
Whilst she does hold views that are deemed controversial, the decision to ban her is unprincipled, immoral, and an anti-productive way to go about dismantling racism.
attributes.additional_details:
Lauren Southern is a Canadian born journalist who rose to fame online when she held up a sign explaining why she does not identify as a feminist. 
Since that photograph, she went on to work for the right-wing media outlet 'Rebel Media', which she has since left to pursue a career as an independent journalist/YouTube personality.

attributes.action: Lower the age for bowel screening in England to 55.
attributes.background: Last year, I lost my role model, my best friend, and my dad. He was diagnosed with Stage 4 bowel cancer with secondary mets to his liver and lymph nodes. He was just 58 years old, had just become a grandad for the first time and had the rest of his life to live.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, the NHS provides bowel screening every 2 years from the age of 60, although evidence from Cancer Research UK shows that between 2012-2014 age-specific incidence rates of bowel cancer rise steeply from around age 50-54. The diagnosis rates are also much higher for men. The current survival rate for stage 4 bowel cancer in men is just 5% compared to stage 3 which is 65%. I truly believe that if the screening age was lowered to 55, that there would be a better chance of survival.

attributes.action: Hold a public inquiry into the decision to incentivise diesel cars & its effects
attributes.background: In 2001 the government decided to link car tax (VED) to CO2 emissions. In 2002 company car tax also became emissions-based. People were encouraged by such incentives to buy diesel cars. Health-damaging air pollution has worsened dramatically and diesel car owners now face punitive charges.
attributes.additional_details:
Two very serious effects of this decision fully justify a public inquiry, to ensure such grave policy mistakes aren't repeated and to consider public compensation:

1. Air pollution now causes 40,000 early deaths in the UK and costs the country Â£27.5bn a year, according to the government's own estimates. MPs have called this a "public health emergency".

2. People encouraged to buy diesel cars now face punitive costs and barriers to their use. This reversal is grievous public maladministration.

attributes.action: Force the chewing gum industry to pay for gum clean up costs - not the taxpayer
attributes.background: Local councils/taxpayers waste over Â£1million A WEEK to scrape chewing gum off our streets. The government must hold billionaire gum producers accountable for the huge costs their products inflict, and legally force them to pay for the clean up costs. Currently, they pay nothing towards these costs.
attributes.additional_details:
Local councils have faced 32% cuts in their budgets since 2010.  It's estimated that 2,000,000 blotches of gum are dropped on pavements every week in the UK, costing Â£1.50 to remove each black/white coloured blotch of gum.

A gum tax needs to be imposed on the sector to help offset the unsustainable and obscene costs that local Councils are currently having to bear - and which diverts scarce funding away from social care, housing and other essential local services.

attributes.action: Change the law: unlicensed drivers are charged with assault with a deadly weapon
attributes.background: In a recent case a young man sustained life threatening and life changing injuries after he hit by an unlicensed driver. Despite being found guilty the offender was only sentenced to two years in prison for causing serious injury by dangerous driving

attributes.action: Make prescriptions for epipens free to anaphylaxis sufferers on the NHS
attributes.background: Vital life-saving drugs qualify for free prescriptions on the NHS, such as those that treat diabetes. Anaphylaxis sufferers have to carry an epipen throughout their life. This is undoubtedly a life-saving medication and should qualify to be on the exemption certificate for free prescriptions.

attributes.action: Means test Prisoners to pay for their care in Prison.
attributes.background: There are Prisoners who have personal assets i.e. properties and bank accounts that should be used to pay for their care, just as those within society have to pay for their care in old age

attributes.action: After the reign of Queen Elizabeth, hold referendum on abolition of royal family
attributes.background: Too expensive to have monarch. Majority of the time monarch does not exercise powers. Feudal system outdated. Britain needs change to more modern and democratic society.
attributes.additional_details: The monarch serves no political purpose. Britain claims to be a democracy - democracy is based on equality, not class hierarchy.

attributes.action: Ban the breeding of Micro Pigs.
attributes.background: We are an animal sanctuary who rescue pet micro pigs, that have been bought has a pet and kept in unsuitable surroundings. We have rescued pigs from 1 bedroom flats, terraced houses, abandoned in fields and town centers. This as become a national and international problem and needs to be stopped.
attributes.additional_details:
We currently have 60 pigs in our care which were originally bred as micro pigs. Our largest rescue pig weighs in at 250kg. Please visit our website: www.pigsinnheaven.co.uk 
Breeders sell these pigs has cute little piglets and tell the public they will grow to the size of a small Labrador but in truth grow much larger and wider. When this happens people do not know what to do with them and contact our sanctuary to see if we can take them. The breeding of so called micro pigs needs to stop now.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to cut grass verges at night-time as it kills nocturnal wildlife
attributes.background: The Council have started to cut grass verges at night-time. This is disastrous for nocturnal wildlife eg hedgehog's, vole's etc as they come out onto the grass verges to feed and travel and are too slow to avoid the mower blades. These animals need protecting and it should be done during the day.

attributes.action: Paramedic students with a first degree to get government student loans.
attributes.background:
NHS funding has stopped this year for Paramedics. It is now a self funded course. Paramedics are an Allied Health Care Profession. 
However unlike other health care professions you cannot get government student finance to cover your course fees, if you have a first degree.
attributes.additional_details:
People affected by this inequality of funding, have been offered university places to study on the grounds that they have the life and education to study and be excellent paramedics. 
However, unlike other allied health care professions paramedic students can not get funding if they have a degree already. If you want to study other health care professions you can get funding. This is very unfair. These students are often making sacrifices and life changes. It is being made almost impossible for us to study as paramedics. We want the same equality as others wanting to study a health care profession. 
We have unsuccessfully asked the University minister, Health and Education ministers to look into this. 
Nothing has changed. 
We have not had a good reason for this inequality.

attributes.action: The Government should ensure women are fully represented across the curriculum.
attributes.background: In the centenary year since the passing of Representation of People Act which enabled women over 30 with property to vote, it seems fitting that the womenâs struggle for equality and equity should be featured across the curriculum as should womenâs achievements which are under represented

attributes.action: Make part time schooling (flexischooling) a legal right for families.
attributes.background: Flexischooling is currently legal at the discretion of the head teacher, but many are too afraid of damaging their attendance statistics to agree. I call on the government to make flexischooling a legal right for all children.

attributes.action: The Government should urge the FA not to sell Wembley
attributes.background: Please help to put a stop to Wembley, a true British Iconic Landmark, being sold.

attributes.action: Raise world wide awareness for kidney condition, Loin Pain Hematuria Syndrome.
attributes.background: Loin Pain Hematuria Syndrome is a rare kidney condition. It has only been documented by just over 1000 worldwide due to it being so rare. This condition is severely disabling, often meaning the person can not work or care for themselves. More information needs to be known and more research done.
attributes.additional_details: By helping us sign the petition, you could be helping people who are suffering in silence. If more information was provided by the medical profession then diagnosis would be easier. I would like to get a plan of action to get leaflets and adverts showing symptoms and how a patient can manage. I donât want anyone to feel like they are alone with this condition.

attributes.action: Create a permanent independent committee to check that the BBC is not biased.
attributes.background: After brexit many people are becoming increasingly concerned that the BBC is trying to promote its own views. We all pay for the BBC and it should be completely even handed in its presentations.

attributes.action: Ban the use of domestic Wood Burning Stoves to improve air quality for all
attributes.background: Wood burning stoves are becoming more and more common which is evidenced by the tangible and demonstrable drop in air quality in recent years. You do not need any scientific equipment to witness the drop in quality. Just step outside on any cold day or night and you will smell the foul acrid smoke.
attributes.additional_details: Breathing clean, unpolluted, fresh smelling air should be a basic human right, but yet in modern Britain it is not as people are permitted to set fire to wood in order to create heat, which is completely unnecessary in 2018. Household wood burners should be banned immediately before more people are duped into buying them under the green banner and releasing more harmful particulates into the air. It is a shame to think that breathing clean fresh crisp winter air is currently a thing of the past.

attributes.action: Allow builders to remove fixed materials if work is unpaid
attributes.background: Many builders are working for the private sector and when final payment is due many clients donât pay due to the law being on there side not allowing the removal of any unpaid fixed materials, we would like the law changed to allow us to remove any unpaid fixed materials to recover the costs

attributes.action: Ban non-biodegradable plastics for single use items
attributes.background: Most single use plastics take over a century to decomposes which is causing a large issue when trying to dispose of it. Non-biodegradable plastics build up in our landfill sites, rivers and oceans affecting a number of bird and marine species. So why not just make single use plastics biodegradable?
attributes.additional_details:
Biodegradable plastics are a better alternative to non-biodegradable plastics because they can be recycled, reused and require less energy to produce.   
We must look to a better and more sustainable future,
Please sign this petition and letâs take action!

attributes.action: Drivers who kill should face life sentences
attributes.background: My son was involved in a RTA and died at the scene. We think that how long the person gets for death by dangerous or careless driving under the influence of drink, drugs or mobile phones is wrong and believe this should be a life for a life sentence.

attributes.action: Issue statement on the draft Directive on copyright in the Digital Single Market
attributes.background: Proposal for a Directive of the European Parliament and of the Council on copyright in the Digital Single Market in its current shape will severly impact the economic freedom and freedom of speech of all EU citizens if implemented. It favours big companies and research institutes over individuals.

attributes.action: Change the law to make it illegal to use fox cage traps in an urban area.
attributes.background: Foxes are being caught in cage traps in a built up residential area where many cats roam free, clearly creating a welfare issue of any animals caught in the trap. It seems the law is morally outdated and needs to be amended to make it illegal to use this kind of device commercially.
attributes.additional_details: Foxes can live in harmony in an urban area. Living next to a business that has recently admitted to legally capturing foxes and releasing them nearby, potentially leaving Cubs to perish. Local cats could also get trapped at any time. This distressed many people on a Facebook post, clearly the current law does not address animal welfare needs or society's current view on trapping foxes, alternative deterrent methods could be used avoiding moving foxes from their environment to protect income.

attributes.action: Establish a United Kingdom Biometric Identification System for all UK citizens.
attributes.background:
Identity for health emergency, retrieval of relevant health records. 
Access to state provision of health care and social security, voting etc 
Prevent abuse by requiring identity for all hospital visits for minors and vulnerable adults.
attributes.additional_details:
Additional info e.g. driving licences, medical alerts, National Insurance card, DBS/CRB, donor preferences, next of kin contact in case of emergency. 
Assist the UK government to protect its citizens from risks associated with terrorism, organised crime, monitoring of convicted felons, illegal immigration. 
Enable UK citizens to prove their right of access, their legitimate identity for their own needs, without the necessity to carry a physical ID card.

The UK Government will establish safeguarding laws. UK citizens would be required to prove identity at the reasonable request of an authorised civil servant.

attributes.action: Work with the devolved Governments to build a bridge between Scotland and NI.
attributes.background:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-scotland-glasgow-west-42772343

"Prof Alan Dunlop thinks the "Celtic bridge" would cost about Â£15bn, a fraction of the estimate of Â£120bn for the English Channel bridge."

"He said it would boost both economies and help the post-Brexit border issue."
attributes.additional_details:
"The business potential is exceptional, the chance of actually really making an investment in what would be the true north."

"We share a lot of history together, similar ideals."

"It would send out a dramatic marker in aspiration for the country going into the 21st Century."

"We do have incredibly talented architects and engineers in Scotland so I am sure that as a technical challenge it wouldn't be insurmountable."

Work with NI Assembly and Scottish Government to build a bridge

attributes.action: Compensatory marks for the Spelling Test of the GPS SATS test KS2 for Dyslexics
attributes.background: Profoundly dyslexic pupils who dont have any other concurring learning difficulty other than their dyslexia need to be given compensatory marks for spelling.It is proven that they cant hear sounds therefore cant distinguish them and therefore wont spell correctly, equal to that of hearing impairment
attributes.additional_details: Dyslexic pupils are expected to achieve 88% on the Grammar Test whilst their average non dyslexic pupils are expected to achieve 66%  to be at National. Non dyslexic pupils can achieve up to 20 marks for spelling whilst dyslexic pupils are discriminated against due to their disability.Pupils report at national standard or not, based on 3 elements of grammar, punctuation & Spelling. Without compensatory marks dyslexic pupils have to achieve 20% higher on G&P in order to be at expected standard

attributes.action: Require cabin boats using UK inland waterways to have Carbon Monoxide detectors
attributes.background: The Smoke & Carbon Monoxide Alarm Regulations 2015 refer to rented properties but the number of deaths from Carbon Monoxide poisoning on boats is increasing. Each year boaters die or are made seriously ill from CO poisoning. Boats are built to keep water out but this also traps gases and fumes.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for landlords/agents to discriminate against you for having pets
attributes.background:
Too many animals are put up for adoption because the landlord, letting agent and property managers wonât allow them in the homes they are letting.  
A sensible solution would be that tenants have to pay a âpet depositâ which would cover any damages caused by animals living in the home.

attributes.action: Scrap the expansion plans for Heathrow Airport
attributes.background: More expansion for London, which the residents don't want. More pollution, years of misery on the M25, and wasting taxpayer money in an outdated hub-and-spoke airport operating model. The rest of the UK would love the chance to expand their infrastructure.
attributes.additional_details: East Midlands Airport in Leicestershire is the absolute logical choice for expanding the UK's network. It's got a HUGE runway (already handles 747s, A380s and An-124s), it's right next to the M42 (for M6) and M1, and it's on the route of HS2. If it has to be in London, then Gatwick is by far a more sensible option when you consider disruption, pollution, and cost.

attributes.action: RAF should provide cover for Air cadet squadrons if CO is unfit for duty
attributes.background: Our squadron (2391 parkstone) has been temporarily suspended due to our CO being unfit for duty. At our squadron, the suspension is affecting us deeply. We believe that we should get to run temporarily with all members of staff (e.g. warrant officer) whilst waiting for a replacement.

attributes.action: Tougher sentences for criminals carrying out vehicle theft
attributes.background:
I recently went through the emotional torture of having my home broken into, my personal belongings rummaged through all in order to steal my 4 week old car from my driveway.
To say I'm heartbroken would be an understatement and anyone that has been through similar would understand these feelings.
attributes.additional_details:
Over the past 3 years, vehicle theft has increased by over 30%!! 40 police forces within England and Wales reported over 85,000 cases last year alone meaning the true figure is tremendously higher.
There is a lot of money in vehicle theft and with the sentence currently standing at 12 months (if charged as High Culpability), you can understand why its on the increase as the criminals feel untouchable

We demand that Vehicle Theft Criminals MUST face far tougher sentences

attributes.action: Make it an offence for a parent to stop child contact with the other parent
attributes.background: There are many parents who use their children as weapons in disputes with their exes. Bitterness between adults should not interfere in a childs upbringing. Stopping a childs contact with the other parent because of anger is child abuse & neglect. Emotional needs are as important as physical needs.
attributes.additional_details: If there is a danger to the child them obviously this is a different scenario but children should not be stopped having contact with either parent because 'mummy is very angry with daddy' and vice versa.

attributes.action: Make Transverse Myelitis recognisable on all life and health insurance policies!
attributes.background: Transverse myelitis is the sister illness to MS! However is unrecognised in mainstream private health and life insurance policies! Which means I canât protect my family if something happened to me! Please sign the petition to make it a legal requirement to add this illness to the list! Thank you.

attributes.action: For doctors in the UK to be legally allowed to prescribe cannabis patches.
attributes.background: This petition has been started in hope that, if enough signatures are obtained, there can be a debate held in parliament to discuss allowing GPs to legally prescribe cannabis patches in the UK for those living with chronic and debilitating conditions.
attributes.additional_details:
The U.S. have been prescribing these patches for some time and the difference it makes to those with chronic and debilitating conditions is quite remarkable. It's about time that the UK government allowed products like these to be issued via prescription by doctors to help improve the quality of life for those individuals who are in a constant high level of pain 24 hours a day. Please consider signing and sharing to try get the number of signatures required.
Thankyou kindly for your support.

attributes.action: Bring in a 3 day cooling off period when buying an animal from a pet shop.
attributes.background: At the moment you can walk into a pet shop and buy any pet. Some stores will offer advice for how to look after them but this does not stop impulse buying of animals. Making people wait 3 days would give them chance to think properly about whether they are making the right decision in buying a pet.
attributes.additional_details:
Quote from the RSPCA website about Rabbits, âIn 2017, we investigated 2,428 complaints of neglect about rabbits and more than 2,000 bunnies were rescued by us last year.â 
If people were sent home for three days after choosing any pet, for example a rabbit, with all the relevant information on care and costs over its life time then the purchase would hopefully be better planned for. This would then hopefully lead to less animals being abandoned. Pets should not be an impulse buy.

attributes.action: Ban schools from supplying milk cartons with plastic straws.
attributes.background: Eco teams from two primary schools in the North West are collaborating to ban plastic straws from school milk after learning about the damage they are causing to our wildlife and habitats.
attributes.additional_details: The children estimate that 1.7 million children have milk each day in Key Stage 1, so approximately 8.5 million straws are discarded each week.  The Government must ban schools from giving children milk with plastic straws, ban local authorities from buying milk with plastic straws, and ensure that all milk supplied to schools meets minimum Eco standards so that no unnecessary plastic, like straws, are used in manufacturing or packaging.

attributes.action: Bring Back the Right of Appeal to Family Visit Visa Applicants.
attributes.background:
The current system of Family Visit Visas is utterly unfair.

a) When one applies for a Family visit Visa & Visa is refused no right of appeal is given. 
b) Decisions are no longer made at the respective Embassies in the country which avoids the face to face interview.
attributes.additional_details:
The system is utterly unfair. Entry Clearance Officers' decisions are poor yet can not be challenged. British citizens & UK residents in the UK are denied spending time with their family members. Refusal letters start: "I recognise that family visits are important" followed by poor arguments & decisions, overlooking facts & evidence in front of ECOs.

Bringing Back the Right of Appeal to Family Visit Visa Applicants would be the best course of action to avoid this appalling abuse.

attributes.action: Legalise and Licence Mace, Pepper, CS Spray for Self-Defence in the UK.
attributes.background:
At the time of writing, there have been 50 killings in 2018 and rising violent crime levels at its highest. 5.3 million violent crimes recorded last year up 14%. There were 37,443 knife crimes and 6,694 gun crime offences recorded last year.

Allow Law abiding citizens the right to carry CS/ Spray
attributes.additional_details:
CS Spray to defend against rapist. 
Allow those of the LGBTQ community to defend against violent attackers. These attack have soared by nearly 80%
Give home owners an effective means of defence from home invaders. 
Spray could be easily licenced and training available. Serial numbers applied on to the Spray cans to stop it falling into criminal hands.
Ask yourself, would you rather these criminals be running around using CS Spray on each other or using Acid, Knives and guns.
GIVE PEOPLE THE CHOICE TO DEFEND THEMSELVES

attributes.action: Make all sex offenders serve the full sentence handed to them. No early release!
attributes.background: With courts unable to give longer sentences due to Government legislation, convicted sex offenders should serve the full sentence handed to them...ESPECIALLY if they make the victim/s go through a trial! There should be no early release.
